question: Who hid Israelite spies in Jericho and was spared when the city fell?
explanation: Rahab hid the spies and marked her house with a scarlet cord, saving her family when Jericho was conquered.

question: Which woman became queen of Persia and saved the Jewish people from destruction?
explanation: Esther risked her life to approach the king and reveal Haman's plot to destroy the Jews.

question: Who was the mother of Samuel, the prophet and judge?
explanation: Hannah prayed earnestly for a son and dedicated Samuel to the Lord's service when he was born.

question: Which prophetess judged Israel and led them in battle against the Canaanites?
explanation: Deborah was a prophetess and judge who summoned Barak to lead Israel's army against Sisera.

question: Which woman said 'Where you go I will go, and where you stay I will stay'?
explanation: Ruth pledged her loyalty to her mother-in-law Naomi with these beautiful words of devotion.

question: Who was the first person to see Jesus after His resurrection?
explanation: Mary Magdalene was the first to see the risen Christ when he appeared to her at the tomb.

question: Which woman anointed Jesus' feet with expensive perfume and wiped them with her hair?
explanation: Mary of Bethany anointed Jesus with expensive nard and wiped his feet with her hair.

question: Who was the mother of John the Baptist?
explanation: Elizabeth, a relative of Mary, gave birth to John the Baptist in her old age.

question: Which woman was raised from the dead by the apostle Peter?
explanation: Peter raised Tabitha (also called Dorcas) from the dead in Joppa, and many believed because of this miracle.

question: Which prophetess spoke about the infant Jesus when He was presented at the temple?
explanation: Anna, a prophetess who was 84 years old, gave thanks to God and spoke about Jesus to all who were waiting for redemption.

question: Who opened her home to house the apostle Peter after he escaped from prison?
explanation: Peter went to the house of Mary, the mother of John Mark, where many had gathered to pray for him.

question: Which woman sold purple cloth and was converted by Paul in Philippi?
explanation: Lydia, a dealer in purple cloth, listened to Paul and the Lord opened her heart to respond to his message.

question: Who was the great-grandmother of King David?
explanation: Ruth was the mother of Obed, who was the father of Jesse, who was the father of David.

question: Which prophetess recognized baby Jesus as the Messiah in the temple?
explanation: Anna, an 84-year-old prophetess, gave thanks to God and spoke about Jesus to all who were waiting for redemption.

question: Who was the wife of Aquila and worked with Paul making tents?
explanation: Priscilla and Aquila were tentmakers who worked with Paul and taught Apollos the way of God more adequately.

question: Who was the mother of Moses?
explanation: Amram married his aunt Jochebed, who bore him Aaron and Moses.

question: Which woman's faith was commended for believing her son would be raised?
explanation: The Shunammite woman's son died, but she sought Elisha who raised him back to life.

question: Which woman was a judge in Israel?
explanation: Deborah, a prophetess and wife of Lappidoth, was leading Israel as a judge at that time.

question: Who did Boaz marry?
explanation: Boaz took Ruth and she became his wife, and the Lord enabled her to conceive.

question: Who was the first woman mentioned in the Bible?
explanation: Adam named his wife Eve because she would become the mother of all the living.

question: Which woman asked for her sons to sit at Jesus' right and left in His kingdom?
choices: The mother of James and John
explanation: The mother of Zebedee's sons came to Jesus with her sons and made this request.

question: Who gave birth to Ishmael?
explanation: Hagar bore Abram a son, and Abram gave the name Ishmael to the son she had borne.

question: Which woman washed Jesus' feet with her tears?
explanation: A woman who had lived a sinful life wept at Jesus' feet, wiped them with her hair, and anointed them.

question: Who was Isaac's wife?
explanation: Isaac brought Rebekah into the tent and she became his wife, and he loved her.

question: Which woman drove a tent peg through Sisera's temple?
explanation: Jael picked up a tent peg and a hammer and drove the peg through Sisera's temple into the ground.

question: Who remained at Jesus' feet while her sister was busy with preparations?
explanation: Mary sat at the Lord's feet listening to what he said while Martha was distracted with preparations.

question: Who was the mother of Samuel?
explanation: Hannah became pregnant and gave birth to a son. She named him Samuel, saying, 'Because I asked the Lord for him.'

question: Who was the wife of Abraham?
explanation: God said to Abraham, 'As for Sarai your wife, you are no longer to call her Sarai; her name will be Sarah.'

question: Which woman was praised for her hospitality to Elisha?
explanation: One day Elisha went to Shunem, and a well-to-do woman urged him to stay for a meal.

question: Who did God tell would be the mother of nations?
explanation: I will bless her and will surely give you a son by her. She will be the mother of nations.

question: Which woman said 'Your people will be my people and your God my God'?
explanation: Ruth replied, 'Where you go I will go, and where you stay I will stay. Your people will be my people.'

question: Who became queen instead of Vashti?
explanation: The king loved Esther more than any of the other women, and she won his favor and became queen.

question: Who helped the Israelite spies escape from Jericho?
explanation: Rahab let them down by a rope through the window, for her house was built into the city wall.

question: Who hid the Israelite spies in Jericho?
explanation: But the woman had taken the two men and hidden them.

question: Who was the prophetess and judge who led Israel?
explanation: Now Deborah, a prophet, the wife of Lappidoth, was leading Israel at that time.

question: Who was the mother of John the Baptist?
explanation: Your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son, and you are to call him John.

question: Which woman anointed Jesus' feet with expensive perfume?
explanation: Mary took about a pint of pure nard, an expensive perfume; she poured it on Jesus' feet.

question: Who was the first woman mentioned in the Bible?
explanation: Adam named his wife Eve, because she would become the mother of all the living.

question: Who was the sister of Moses and Aaron?
explanation: Then Miriam the prophet, Aaron's sister, took a timbrel in her hand.

question: Which woman hid Israelite spies in Jericho?
explanation: Rahab hid the spies on her roof among stalks of flax and helped them escape from Jericho.

question: Who was the mother of John the Baptist?
explanation: Elizabeth, a relative of Mary, gave birth to John the Baptist in her old age.

question: Which woman drove a tent peg through the head of Sisera?
explanation: Jael killed the Canaanite commander Sisera by driving a tent peg through his temple while he slept.

question: Who was the first woman mentioned in the Bible?
explanation: Adam named his wife Eve because she would become the mother of all the living.

question: Which woman was turned into a pillar of salt?
explanation: Lot's wife looked back at Sodom and Gomorrah despite being warned not to, and became a pillar of salt.

question: Who was the great-grandmother of King David?
explanation: Ruth married Boaz and gave birth to Obed, who was the father of Jesse, the father of David.

question: Which prophetess recognized baby Jesus in the temple?
explanation: Anna, a prophetess of great age, gave thanks to God and spoke about Jesus to all who were waiting for redemption.

question: Who poured expensive perfume on Jesus' feet?
explanation: Mary took expensive perfume, poured it on Jesus' feet and wiped His feet with her hair.

question: Who was the first person to see the risen Christ?
explanation: Jesus said to her, 'Mary.' She turned toward Him and cried out, 'Rabboni!'

question: Who was commended for choosing what is better - sitting at Jesus' feet?
explanation: Mary has chosen what is better, and it will not be taken away from her.

question: Who offered to sell all she had to help Paul?
explanation: When Lydia and her household were baptized, she invited Paul to stay at her house.

question: Which woman was a seller of purple cloth?
explanation: One of those listening was Lydia, a dealer in purple cloth from the city of Thyatira.

question: Who was known for her many acts of kindness and charity?
explanation: In Joppa there was a disciple named Tabitha who was always doing good and helping the poor.

question: Who assisted Paul and taught Apollos?
explanation: Priscilla and Aquila invited Apollos to their home and explained to him the way of God more adequately.

question: Who was the first female judge of Israel?
explanation: Now Deborah, a prophet, the wife of Lappidoth, was leading Israel at that time.

question: Which woman hid spies on her roof?
explanation: But she had taken them up to the roof and hidden them under the stalks of flax she had laid out on the roof.

question: Who was the mother of John the Baptist?
explanation: But the angel said to him: 'Do not be afraid, Zechariah; your prayer has been heard. Your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son.'

question: Which prophetess spoke about Jesus when He was presented at the temple?
explanation: There was also a prophet, Anna, the daughter of Penuel, of the tribe of Asher. She was very old.

question: Who helped Timothy develop his faith from childhood?
choices: His mother Eunice and grandmother Lois
explanation: I am reminded of your sincere faith, which first lived in your grandmother Lois and in your mother Eunice.

question: Which woman was commended for her hospitality to Elisha?
explanation: One day Elisha went to Shunem. And a well-to-do woman was there, who urged him to stay for a meal.

question: Who was the wife of Aquila?
explanation: There he met a Jew named Aquila, a native of Pontus, who had recently come from Italy with his wife Priscilla.
